data.text: you need perfectly round frame tubes to convert to S & S, which many bikes don't have. However, being able to carry your bike in a slightly larger than normal suitcase will save several hundred $$ on extra flight baggage charges each time you do a round trip to Europe. I have taken my Ritchey Breakaway on around 10 trips overseas over the past 10 years and have never been charged the extra 'bicycle' cost.

data.text: S&S is great, I have them and have used them a good few times. I would still prefer to ship my bike in one piece whenever I can as it saves time and will likely cause less damage to frame and parts. still, the couplers have paid themselves back with the money I have saved by not having to pay for excess luggage (depending on which airline the bicycle and panniers fit within their checked-in baggage allowance).
